IP.Name: LoRaWAN
IP.About: Middleware enabling LoRaWAN based on LoRa modulations.

RefParameter.Name: SUBGHZ_APPLICATION
RefParameter.Description: List of available applications

RefParameter.Name: USE_LPM
RefParameter.Description: Allow pre-fill of stm32_lpm_if.c file.

RefParameter.Name: USE_ADC
RefParameter.Comment: Use ADC for T° and battery management
RefParameter.Description:
ADC: Proposed solution to manage radio settings depending on Vrefint and device internal T°.
   • For Dual Core operation Runtime Context is Cortex-M4
Mode: Temperature Sensor Channel and Vrefint Channel
Configuration: - Parameters Settings:
   • Clock Prescaler: Synchronous clock mode divided by 4
   • Overrun behaviour: Overrun data overwritten
   • SamplingTime Common 1 and 2: 160.5 Cycles

LoRaWAN - Platform Settings panel: Platform proposals
   • Ensure that ADC is selected in Found Solutions

RefParameter.Name: USE_RTC
RefParameter.Description:
RTC: Proposed solution to manage timer in Low Power mode.
   • For Dual Core operation Runtime Contexts are both Cortex-M4 and Cortex-M0+ and initializer is Cortex-M0+
Mode: Activate Clock Source, Activate Calendar and activate Alarm A (and B for Dual Core) (Internal Alarm A (and B for Dual Core))
User Constants: Add the following Constants
   • Constant Name: RTC_N_PREDIV_S Value: 10
   • Constant Name: RTC_PREDIV_S Value: ((1 << RTC_N_PREDIV_S)-1)
   • Constant Name: RTC_PREDIV_A Value: ((1 << (15-RTC_N_PREDIV_S))-1)
Configuration - Parameters Settings:
   • Asynchronous Predivider value: Set value to RTC_PREDIV_A
   • Bin Mode: Free running Binary mode
   • Alarm A Binary AutoControl: RTC_ALARMSUBSECONDBIN_AUTOCLR_NO
Configuration - NVIC settings:
   • Enable both Interrupts

LoRaWAN - Platform Settings panel: Platform proposals
   • Ensure that RTC is selected in Found Solutions

RefParameter.Name: USE_UART
RefParameter.Description:
USART/LPUART: Proposed solution to manage trace.
   • For Dual Core operation Runtime Context is Cortex-M4
Mode: Asynchronous
Configuration - Parameters Settings:
   • If LPUART is selected then set Baud Rate: 9600 Bits/s
Configuration - DMA Settings:
   • Add USARTx_TX DMA Request with Channel configured with DMA1 Channel 5
Configuration - NVIC settings:
   • Enable both Interrupts
Clock Configuration panel
   • If LPUART is selected then set Clock Mux to LSE
NVIC Mode and Configuration panel - Preemption priority management
   • Set preemption Priority for DMA and UART Interrupt to 2

LoRaWAN - Platform Settings panel: Platform proposals
   • Ensure that chosen UART is selected in Found Solutions

RefParameter.Name: USER_GUIDANCE
RefParameter.DefaultValue: !! Please read carefully Information panel below!!
RefParameter.Description:
ADC: Proposed solution to manage radio settings depending on Vrefint and device internal T°.
   • For Dual Core operation: Runtime Contexts is Cortex-M4
Mode: Temperature Sensor Channel and Vrefint Channel
Configuration: - Parameters Settings:
   • Clock Prescaler: Synchronous clock mode divided by 4
   • Overrun behaviour: Overrun data overwritten
   • SamplingTime Common 1 and 2: 160.5 Cycles

RTC: Proposed solution to manage timer in Low Power mode.
   • For Dual Core operation Runtime Contexts are both Cortex-M4 and Cortex-M0+ and initializer is Cortex-M0+
Mode: Activate Clock Source, Activate Calendar and activate Alarm A (and B for Dual Core) (Internal Alarm A (and B for Dual Core))
User Constants: Add the following Constants
   • Constant Name: RTC_N_PREDIV_S Value: 10
   • Constant Name: RTC_PREDIV_S Value: ((1 << RTC_N_PREDIV_S)-1)
   • Constant Name: RTC_PREDIV_A Value: ((1 << (15-RTC_N_PREDIV_S))-1)
Configuration - Parameters Settings:
   • Asynchronous Predivider value: Set value to RTC_PREDIV_A
   • Bin Mode: Free running Binary mode
   • Alarm A Binary AutoControl: RTC_ALARMSUBSECONDBIN_AUTOCLR_NO
Configuration - NVIC settings:
   • Enable both Interrupts

RCC: Proposed solution to manage RCC.
Mode: Low Speed Clock (LSE): Set value to Crystal Ceramic Resonator
Configuration - Parameters Settings:
   • Flash Latency(WS): 2 WS (3 CPU cycle)
   • Power Regulator Voltage Scale: Scale 1
Clock Configuration panel
   • Set MSI RC to 32MHz
   • Set RTC Clock Mux to LSE

USART/LPUART: Proposed solution to manage trace.
   • For Dual Core operation: Runtime Contexts is Cortex-M4
Mode: Asynchronous
Configuration - Parameters Settings:
   • If LPUART is selected then set Baud Rate: 9600 Bits/s
Configuration - DMA Settings:
   • Add USARTx_TX DMA Request with Channel configured with DMA1 Channel 5
Configuration - NVIC settings:
   • Enable both Interrupts
Clock Configuration panel
   • If LPUART is selected then set Clock Mux to LSE
NVIC Mode and Configuration panel - Preemption priority management
   • Set preemption Priority for DMA and UART Interrupt to 2

LoRaWAN - Platform Settings panel: Platform proposals
   • Ensure that relevant solutions are properly selected

Project Manager- Advanced Settings panel: Generated Function Calls management
   • Untick "Generate Code" for RTC on CortexM4 and DMA on CortexM0PLUS for Dual Core
   • Tick "Do Not Generate Function Call" for DMA (CortexM4 only for DualCore), ADC, RTC, SUBGHZ, UART and IPCC(for Dual Core)
   • Untick Visibility for all Function Calls on both cores

RefParameter.Name: USER_GUIDANCE
RefParameter.DefaultValue: !! Please read carefully Information panel below!!
RefParameter.Description:
ADC: Proposed solution to manage radio settings depending on Vrefint and device internal T°.
   • For Dual Core operation: Runtime Contexts is Cortex-M4
Mode: Temperature Sensor Channel and Vrefint Channel
Configuration: - Parameters Settings:
   • Clock Prescaler: Synchronous clock mode divided by 4
   • Overrun behaviour: Overrun data overwritten
   • SamplingTime Common 1 and 2: 160.5 Cycles

RTC: Proposed solution to manage timer in Low Power mode.
   • For Dual Core operation Runtime Contexts are both Cortex-M4 and Cortex-M0+ and initializer is Cortex-M0+
Mode: Activate Clock Source, Activate Calendar and activate Alarm A (and B for Dual Core) (Internal Alarm A (and B for Dual Core))
User Constants: Add the following Constants
   • Constant Name: RTC_N_PREDIV_S Value: 10
   • Constant Name: RTC_PREDIV_S Value: ((1 << RTC_N_PREDIV_S)-1)
   • Constant Name: RTC_PREDIV_A Value: ((1 << (15-RTC_N_PREDIV_S))-1)
Configuration - Parameters Settings:
   • Asynchronous Predivider value: Set value to RTC_PREDIV_A
   • Bin Mode: Free running Binary mode
   • Alarm A Binary AutoControl: RTC_ALARMSUBSECONDBIN_AUTOCLR_NO
Configuration - NVIC settings:
   • Enable both Interrupts

RCC: Proposed solution to manage RCC.
Mode: Low Speed Clock (LSE): Set value to Crystal Ceramic Resonator
Configuration - Parameters Settings:
   • Flash Latency(WS): 2 WS (3 CPU cycle)
   • Power Regulator Voltage Scale: Scale 1
Clock Configuration panel
   • Set MSI RC to 48MHz
   • Set RTC Clock Mux to LSE

LPUART: Proposed solution to manage trace.
   • For Dual Core operation Runtime Context is Cortex-M4
Mode: Asynchronous
Configuration - Parameters Settings:
   • Baud Rate: 9600 Bits/s
Configuration - DMA Settings:
   • Add USARTx_TX DMA Request with Channel configured with DMA1 Channel 5
Configuration - NVIC settings:
   • Enable both Interrupts
Clock Configuration panel
   • Set LPUART1 Clock Mux to LSE
NVIC Mode and Configuration panel - Preemption priority management
   • Set preemption Priority for DMA and UART Interrupt to 2

LoRaWAN - Platform Settings panel: Platform proposals
   • Ensure that relevant solutions are properly selected

Project Manager - Advanced Settings panel: Generated Function Calls management
   • Untick "Generate Code" for RTC on CortexM4 and DMA on CortexM0PLUS for Dual Core
   • Tick "Do Not Generate Function Call" for DMA (CortexM4 only for DualCore), ADC, RTC, SUBGHZ, UART and IPCC(for Dual Core)
   • Untick Visibility for all Function Calls on both cores

RefParameter.Name: USER_GUIDANCE
RefParameter.DefaultValue: !! Please read carefully Information panel below!!
RefParameter.Description:
RCC: Proposed solution to manage RCC.
Mode: Low Speed Clock (LSE): Set value to Crystal Ceramic Resonator
Configuration - Parameters Settings:
   • Flash Latency(WS): 2 WS (3 CPU cycle)
   • Power Regulator Voltage Scale: Scale 1
Clock Configuration panel
   • Set MSI RC to 32MHz
   • Set RTC Clock Mux to LSE

Project Manager- Advanced Settings panel: Generated Function Calls management
   • Untick "Generate Code" for RTC on CortexM4 for Dual Core if you decide to use RTC for Timer and DMA on CortexM0PLUS for Dual Core
   • Tick "Do Not Generate Function Call" for DMA, ADC, RTC, SUBGHZ and IPCC(for Dual Core)
   • Untick Visibility for all Function Calls on both cores

RefParameter.Name: LOW_POWER_DISABLE
RefParameter.Description: It goes only to SLEEP but not to STOP mode

RefParameter.Name: LOW_POWER_DISABLE
RefParameter.Description: It goes only to SLEEP but not to STOP mode

RefParameter.Name: LOW_POWER_DISABLE_CM4
RefParameter.Description: It goes only to SLEEP but not to STOP mode

RefParameter.Name: LOW_POWER_DISABLE_CM4
RefParameter.Description: It goes only to SLEEP but not to STOP mode

RefParameter.Name: LOW_POWER_DISABLE_CM0PLUS
RefParameter.Description: It goes only to SLEEP but not to STOP mode

RefParameter.Name: LOW_POWER_DISABLE_CM0PLUS
RefParameter.Description: It goes only to SLEEP but not to STOP mode

RefParameter.Name: SENSOR_ENABLED
RefParameter.Description: Not available in this version

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_PUBLIC_NETWORK
RefParameter.Description: Indicates if the end-device is to be connected to a private or public network

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_NETWORK_ID
RefParameter.Description: Current network ID

RefParameter.Name: STATIC_DEVICE_EUI

PossibleValue.Comment: SW dynamically generated based on unique board ID

RefParameter.Description:
When set to true DevEui is LORAWAN_DEVICE_EUI
When set to false DevEui is automatically generated by calling BoardGetUniqueId function

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_DEVICE_EUI
RefParameter.Description: Mote device IEEE EUI (big endian)

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_DEVICE_EUI
RefParameter.Description: Mote device IEEE EUI (big endian)

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_DEVICE_EUI_HEX
RefParameter.Description: Mote device IEEE EUI (big endian)

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_DEVICE_EUI_HEX
RefParameter.Description: Mote device IEEE EUI (big endian)

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_JOIN_EUI
RefParameter.Description: App/Join IEEE EUI (big endian)

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_JOIN_EUI_HEX
RefParameter.Description: App/Join IEEE EUI (big endian)

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_NWK_KEY
RefParameter.Description: Network root key

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_APP_KEY
RefParameter.Description: Application root key

RefParameter.Name: STATIC_DEVICE_ADDRESS
RefParameter.Description:
When set to true DevAdd is LORAWAN_DEVICE_ADDRESS
When set to false DevAdd is automatically generated using a pseudo random generator seeded with a value derived from BoardUniqueId value

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_DEVICE_ADDRESS
RefParameter.Description: Device address on the network (big endian)

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_DEVICE_ADDRESS
RefParameter.Description: Device address on the network (big endian)

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_NWK_S_KEY
RefParameter.Description: WARNING: NWK_S_KEY FOR 1.0.x DEVICES

RefParameter.Name: Activate_BOARD_RESOURCES
RefParameter.Description: Enable LEDs and BUTTONs settings using GPIO under Plaform Settings panel or via .extSettings file

RefParameter.Name: Activate_BOARD_RESOURCES
RefParameter.Description: Enable LEDs and BUTTONs settings using GPIO under Plaform Settings panel or via .extSettings file

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_TIMER_OR_BUTTON
RefParameter.Comment: Send Tx on Timer or Button Evt

RefParameter.Name: ACTIVE_REGION
RefParameter.Description: List of available regions is set in lorawan_conf.h available under LoRaWAN middleware panel

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_DEFAULT_CLASS
RefParameter.Description: @note do not use 224. It is reserved for certification

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_DEFAULT_CLASS
RefParameter.Description: @note do not use 224. It is reserved for certification

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_ADR_STATE
RefParameter.Description: @note Please note that when ADR is enabled the end-device should be static

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_DEFAULT_DATA_RATE
RefParameter.Description: @note Please note that LORAWAN_DEFAULT_DATA_RATE is used only when ADR is disabled

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_DEFAULT_DATA_RATE
RefParameter.Description: @note Please note that LORAWAN_DEFAULT_DATA_RATE is used only when ADR is disabled

RefParameter.Name: LORAWAN_DEFAULT_PING_SLOT_PERIODICITY
RefParameter.Description: Periodicity is equal to 2^LORAWAN_DEFAULT_PING_SLOT_PERIODICITY seconds (ex: : 2^3 = 8 seconds. The end-device will open an Rx slot every 8 seconds).

RefParameter.Name: REGION
RefParameter.DefaultValue: please select the desired region(s) in the list below

RefParameter.Name: LORAMAC_CLASSB_ENABLED
RefParameter.Description: This class is a compromise between power consumption and bidirectional communication needs

RefParameter.Name: Activate_DEBUG_LINE
RefParameter.Description: Enable Probes Line using GPIO under Plaform Settings panel

RefParameter.Name: Activate_DEBUG_LINE
RefParameter.Description: Enable Probes Line using GPIO under Plaform Settings panel

RefParameter.Name: RF_WAKEUP_TIME
RefParameter.Description: Radio maximum wakeup time (in ms)

RefParameter.Name: Activate_RADIO_BOARD_INTERFACE
RefParameter.Description: UserBoard: user to complete; Bsp: need to be included in the IDE.

RefParameter.Name: IS_TCXO_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description: Indicates whether or not TCXO is supported by the board. TCXO needs to be selected in RCC panel (HSE clock)

RefParameter.Name: IS_TCXO_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description: You need to activate TCXO in RCC configuration panel

RefParameter.Name: IS_DCDC_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description: Indicates whether or not DCDC is supported by the board

RefParameter.Name: TX_RFO_CONFIG
RefParameter.Description: Indicates the config

BspDependency.Comment: Use the User Led for this application

BspDependency.Name: USART

Condition.Expression: ((STM32WL55UCYx | STM32WL55CCUx | STM32WL55JCIx | STM32WL54CCUx | STM32WL54JCIx) & !S_SubGhzPhy & !S_Sigfox & S_SUBGHZ & S_IPCC_Enabled & !S_SINGLE_CORE) | ((STM32WL55UCYx | STM32WL55CCUx | STM32WL55JCIx | STM32WL54CCUx | STM32WL54JCIx) & !S_SubGhzPhy & !S_Sigfox & S_SUBGHZ & S_SINGLE_CORE) | ((!STM32WL55UCYx & !STM32WL55CCUx & !STM32WL55JCIx & !STM32WL54CCUx & !STM32WL54JCIx) & !S_SubGhzPhy & !S_Sigfox & S_SUBGHZ)
Condition.Diagnostic: You can enable this middleware only if only if SubGHz IP is enabled and SubGHz_Phy and Sigfox middlewares are not enabled. For Dual Core product you need also to activate IPCC
